00002 #define MD5_H

00044 #include <stdio.h>
00045 #include <fstream>
00046 #include <iostream>
00047 using namespace std;
00048 
00049 class MD5 {
00050 
00051 public:
00052 // methods for controlled operation:
00053   MD5              ();  // simple initializer
00054   void  update     (const unsigned char *input, unsigned int input_length);
00055   void  update     (istream& stream);
00056   void  update     (FILE *file);
00057   void  update     (ifstream& stream);
00058   void  finalize   ();
00059 
00060 // constructors for special circumstances.  All these constructors finalize
00061 // the MD5 context.
00062   MD5              (const unsigned char *string); // digest string, finalize
00063   MD5              (istream& stream);       // digest stream, finalize
00064   MD5              (FILE *file);            // digest file, close, finalize
00065   MD5              (ifstream& stream);      // digest stream, close, finalize
00066 
00067 // methods to acquire finalized result
00068   unsigned char    *raw_digest ();  // digest as a 16-byte binary array
00069   char *            hex_digest ();  // digest as a 33-byte ascii-hex string
00070   friend ostream&   operator<< (ostream&, MD5 context);
00071 
00072 
00073 
00074 private:
00075 
00076 // first, some types:
00077   typedef unsigned       int uint4; // assumes integer is 4 words long
00078   typedef unsigned short int uint2; // assumes short integer is 2 words long
00079   typedef unsigned      char uint1; // assumes char is 1 word long
00080 
00081 // next, the private data:
00082   uint4 state[4];
00083   uint4 count[2];     // number of *bits*, mod 2^64
00084   uint1 buffer[64];   // input buffer
00085   uint1 digest[16];
00086   uint1 finalized;
00087 
00088 // last, the private methods, mostly static:
00089   void init             ();               // called by all constructors
00090   void transform        (const uint1 *buffer);  // does the real update work.  Note 
00091                                           // that length is implied to be 64.
00092 
00093   static void encode    (uint1 *dest, const uint4 *src, uint4 length);
00094   static void decode    (uint4 *dest, const uint1 *src, uint4 length);
00095   static void memcpy    (uint1 *dest, const uint1 *src, uint4 length);
00096   static void memset    (uint1 *start, uint1 val, uint4 length);
00097 
00098   static inline uint4  rotate_left (uint4 x, uint4 n);
00099   static inline uint4  F           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00100   static inline uint4  G           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00101   static inline uint4  H           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00102   static inline uint4  I           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00103   static inline void   FF  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x, 
00104                             uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00105   static inline void   GG  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x, 
00106                             uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00107   static inline void   HH  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x, 
00108                             uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00109   static inline void   II  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x, 
00110                             uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00111 
00112 };
00113 #endif
